etymology.description: phonetic: 公 (OC *kloːŋ) + semantic: 羽 (“wings”); originally “feathers”, later loaned to mean “old man” via 公.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 羽 ‘feather’ as the meaning element with 公 as the sound, matching the OC reading near *qloːŋ. The sense shifted from ‘feathers’ to ‘old man’ by semantic loan, likely influenced by 公 ‘duke/public figure’ as a respectful association with an elder.

examples.chinese: 那位老翁在桥上钓鱼(那位老翁在橋上釣魚)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi lǎo wēng zài qiáo shàng diào yú.
examples.english: That old man is fishing on the bridge.

examples.chinese: 两虎相争，渔翁得利(兩虎相爭，漁翁得利)。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng hǔ xiāngzhēng, yúwēng dé lì.
examples.english: When two sides fight, the fisherman profits.

examples.chinese: 他们家翁婿相处融洽(他們家翁婿相處融洽)。
examples.english: The father-in-law and son-in-law in their family get along well.
